alert.note: Alert for Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 1:11PM CDT until June 22 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of the Panhandle of Oklahoma, including the following county, Beaver. Portions of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Hansford, Hutchinson and Ochiltree. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Perryton, Spearman, Gruver, Waka, Farnsworth and Morse. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
